title: Member Lecture: David Hockney—The Arrival of Spring, Normandy, 2020
title_display: Member Lecture: David Hockney—The Arrival of Spring, Normandy, 2020
short_description: Associate curator of modern and contemporary art Robyn Farrell discusses the exhibition David Hockney: The Arrival of Spring, Normandy, 2020.
list_description: Associate curator of modern and contemporary art Robyn Farrell discusses the exhibition David Hockney: The Arrival of Spring, Normandy, 2020.
description:
Associate curator of modern and contemporary art Robyn Farrell discusses the exhibition David Hockney: The Arrival of Spring, Normandy, 2020.

A defining figure of the British Pop Art movement, Hockney is known for his vivid landscapes, domestic scenes, and intimate portraits. Two years ago, Hockney traveled to France with the express intention of capturing the arrival of spring and created a series of joyful paintings using the medium of the iPad. In this lecture, Farrell will contextualize this most recent series within Hockney's six-decade practice.

Please note that this is an in-person event that takes place at the museum.

In accordance with state and City of Chicago guidelines, visitors to the museum are no longer required to wear masks or provide proof of vaccination. Anyone who would like to continue to wear a mask is welcome to do so. Learn more about our visiting policies and what to expect.

If you have any questions about programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.

Closed captioning will be available for this program. For questions related to accessibility accommodations, please email access@artic.edu.
